verses.verse: A Prayer<WH8605> of Moses<WH4872> the man<WH376> of God.<WH430> Lord,<WH136> you have been<WH1961> our dwelling<WH4583> place in all generations.<WH1755>

Before<WH2962> the mountains<WH2022> were brought<WH3205> forth,<WH3205> or ever you had formed<WH2342> the earth<WH776> and the world,<WH8398> even from everlasting<WH5769> to everlasting,<WH5769> you are God.<WH410>
You turn<WH7725> man<WH582> to destruction;<WH1793> and say,<WH559> Return,<WH7725> you children<WH1121> of men.<WH120>
For a thousand<WH505> years<WH8141> in your sight<WH5869> are but as yesterday<WH865> when<WH3588> it is past,<WH5674> and as a watch<WH821> in the night.<WH3915>
You carry<WH2229> them away as with a flood;<WH2229> they are as a sleep:<WH8142> in the morning<WH1242> they are like grass<WH2682> which grows<WH2498> up.
In the morning<WH1242> it flourishes,<WH6692> and grows<WH2498> up; in the evening<WH6153> it is cut<WH4135> down, and wither.<WH3001>
For we are consumed<WH3615> by your anger,<WH639> and by your wrath<WH2534> are we troubled.<WH926>
You have set<WH7896> our iniquities<WH5771> before<WH5048> you, our secret<WH5956> sins in the light<WH3974> of your countenance.<WH6440>
For all<WH3605> our days<WH3117> are passed<WH6437> away in your wrath:<WH5678> we spend<WH3615> our years<WH8141> as a tale<WH1899> that is told.

The days<WH3117> of our years<WH8141> are three score<WH7657> years<WH8141> and ten; and if<WH518> by reason of strength<WH1369> they be fourscore<WH8084> years,<WH8141> yet is their strength<WH7296> labor<WH5999> and sorrow;<WH205> for it is soon<WH2440> cut<WH1504> off, and we fly<WH5774> away.
Who<WH4310> knows<WH3045> the power<WH5797> of your anger?<WH639> even according to your fear,<WH3374> so is your wrath.<WH5678>
So<WH3651> teach<WH3045> us to number<WH4487> our days,<WH3117> that we may apply<WH935> our hearts<WH3824> to wisdom.<WH2451>
Return,<WH7725> O LORD,<WH3068> how<WH5704> long?<WH5704> and let it repent<WH5162> you concerning<WH5921> your servants.<WH5650>
O satisfy<WH7646> us early<WH1242> with your mercy;<WH2617> that we may rejoice<WH7442> and be glad<WH8056> all<WH3605> our days.<WH3117>
Make us glad<WH8056> according to the days<WH3117> wherein you have afflicted<WH6031> us, and the years<WH8141> wherein we have seen<WH7200> evil.<WH7451>
Let your work<WH6467> appear<WH7200> to your servants,<WH5650> and your glory<WH1926> to their children.<WH1121>

And let the beauty<WH5278> of the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> be on us: and establish<WH3559> you the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> on us; yes, the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> establish<WH3559> you it.
